paragraphs.text: %md ## OML4SQL Data Transformation: Normalization and Scale In this notebook, we demonstrate how to normalize and scale data using Oracle SQL and the DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM package. We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set, which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance. We show how to normalize data usig using z-score (mean and standard deviation), min max scaling, and log scaling. The dataset `CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL` is generated by the `"OML Run-me-first"` notebook, which `MUST` be run before this notebook. --- ##### `IMPORTANT`: The `"OML Run-me-first"` notebook is available under the menu Templates -> Examples and is a pre-requisite to the current notebook. --- **Note**: when building or applying a model using in-database Oracle Machine Learning algorithms, automatic data preparation will normalize data automatically as needed by specific algorithms. For more details, see Data Preparation for GLM Copyright (c) 2023 Oracle Corporation ###### The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0 ---

msg.data:
OML4SQL Data Transformation: Normalization and Scale

In this notebook, we demonstrate how to normalize and scale data using Oracle SQL and the DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM package.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set, which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

We show how to normalize data usig using z-score (mean and standard deviation), min max scaling, and log scaling.

The dataset CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL is generated by the "OML Run-me-first" notebook, which MUST be run before this notebook.

IMPORTANT: The "OML Run-me-first" notebook is available under the menu Templates -> Examples and is a pre-requisite to the current notebook.

Note: when building or applying a model using in-database Oracle Machine Learning algorithms, automatic data preparation will normalize data automatically as needed by specific algorithms. For more details, see Data Preparation for GLM

Copyright (c) 2023 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: For more information ...
paragraphs.text: %md OML4SQL ORACLE_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM Documentation: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/arpls/DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM.html OML folder on Oracle Github : https://github.com/oracle-samples/oracle-db-examples/tree/main/machine-learning

FETCH FIRST 20 ROWS ONLY;

paragraphs.title: Log scale transformation - for each numerical column apply log(10, ) to its nonzero values
Check view that contains log transformed value
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT ROUND(LOG_CREDIT_BALANCE, 4) LOG_CREDIT_BALANCE, 
    ROUND(LOG_CUSTOMER_TENURE,4) LOG_CUSTOMER_TENURE, 
    ROUND(LOG_MORTGAGE_AMOUNT,4) LOG_MORTGAGE_AMOUNT, 
    ROUND(LOG_TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS,4) LOG_TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS,
    ROUND(LOG_BANK_FUNDS,4) LOG_BANK_FUNDS,
    ROUND(LOG_INCOME,4) LOG_INCOME
FROM customer_log_v
FETCH FIRST 20 ROWS ONLY;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Check original distribution of TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS - note distribution is heavily skewed
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT ROUND(TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS*1.0/100000, 1)*100000, COUNT(1) CNT
FROM   CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL
WHERE TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS > 0
GROUP BY ROUND(TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS*1.0/100000, 1)*100000
ORDER BY ROUND(TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS*1.0/100000, 1)*100000;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: After applying log transformation, distribution becomes better distributed
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT ROUND(LOG_TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS/10,1)*10, COUNT(1) CNT
FROM   customer_log_v
WHERE  LOG_TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS > 0
GROUP BY ROUND(LOG_TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS/10,1)*10
ORDER BY ROUND(LOG_TOTAL_AUTOM_PAYMENTS/10,1)*10
